WHO I AM?

I'm Ariel Kohan, a 21 years old student of Systems Engineering based in Paraná, Argentina.
I know that I am presently going through a stage in my life which will determine my future path. This feeling strongly motivates me to learn something new every day with reference to ongoing training, work issues, as well as personal entrepreneurship and creativity.
In software development, like in running and in every aspect of my life, I'm addicted to set me challenging goals that makes me work really hard and feels that I'm better than yesterday.
If you want, you could check out my Linkedin Profile.

Goal Accomplished

Córdoba, Argentina. March 2016. 21 kilometers across the mountains:
nothing feels better than achieving a milestone after a long time of hard work and effort.

Strengths

Software Development.

I have been working by years in different kind of software platforms like web, desktop or mobile. The common thing that all my projects have is the passion. The passion to solve the problem with minimum computational effort, to make a good design that be attractive for the users, to help clients to grow, to make someone happy with the result. I always spend time learning new things that transform me in a better programmer and cover general or particular needs.

Leadership.

Other thing that I love to do is help my teammates to reach their full potential, not only in the software area but also as a person. I think that the most important in a work relation is the respect and the fellowship. Is always crucial to share experience and listen mindfully what the others says.

Fast learning.

A definition of learn: “to acquire knowledge of or skill in by study, instruction, or experience”. I’m always looking for an opportunity to learn something, and fortunately, I have observed that I can do it in less time than other people. The technology moves quickly and in the IT careers it means that we need to be always using something new. This facility will help me adapt to any situation.

Work under pressure.

Since I was born, I have been working in this ability: finishing the homework before the deadline, passing the exams, shooting the last ball of the basketball match, releasing the software project on schedule. I develop the capacity to focus despite of the environment and I think it will help me to do great things in any place.

SKILLS

Languages

HTML

HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language and describes the structure of Web pages. Browsers use HTML tags to render the content of the page. See more...

CSS

CSS stands for cascade Style Sheet and is a language that describes the style (color, shapes, shadows and other things) of an HTML document. See more...

JavaScript

JavaScript is a programming language used to make web pages interactive. It runs on your visitor's computer and doesn't require constant downloads from your website. JavaScript is often used to create polls and quizzes. See more...

JAVA

Java is a programming language and computing platform first released by Sun Microsystems in 1995. There are lots of applications and websites that will not work unless you have Java installed, and more are created every day. Java is fast, secure, and reliable. It is used in Android Apps, Server Apps, Java Web applications and other kind of places.

SQL

SQL stands for Structured Query Language and is a standard language for accessing databases.

Frameworks & Platforms

Angular.js

Angular is a JavaScript framework created by Google based on MVC pattern that allow you to build structured browser-side applications. It is perfect for Single Page Applications. See more in the official site.

JQuery

jQuery is a cross-platform JavaScript library designed to simplify the client-side scripting of HTML. It is designed to make it easier to navigate the HTML document, select HTML elements, create animations, handle events, and develop interactive Web applications. See more in the official site.

SASS

Sass stands for Syntactically Awesome Stylesheets and is a scripting language that extends CSS by allowing developers to write code in one language and then compile it into CSS. Sass allows you to use things like variables, nested rules, inline imports and more. It also helps to keep things organized and allows you to create stylesheets faster. See more in the official site.

Android

The Android platform is a platform for mobile devices that uses a modified Linux kernel. The Android Platform was introduced by the Open Handset Alliance in November of 2007. Most applications that run on the Android platform are written in the Java programming language.

JAVA Spring & Hibernate

The Spring Framework is an application framework and inversion of control container for the Java platform. The framework's core features can be used by any Java application, but there are extensions for building simple, portable, fast and flexible JVM-based systems and Web applications. Hibernate ORM enables developers to more easily write applications whose data outlives the application process. As an Object/Relational Mapping (ORM) framework, Hibernate is concerned with data persistence as it applies to relational databases. In addition to its own "native" API, Hibernate is also an implementation of the Java Persistence API (JPA) specification.
